bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to L. O. Howard, November 18, 1928

div1.p: Carter thanks Howard for sending her a reference from the Bulletin of Entomological Research and updates him on her progress.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to L. O. Howard, November 18, 1928

opener.dateline:
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
November 18, 1928.

div1.p:
How very kind of you to remember my bibliographic
problems and to send me the reference to Dunn's article in
the Bullentin of Entomological Research for February! I
should have at once acknowledged your letter had I not hurt
my right hand, about two weeks ago, and I am now just be-
ginning to use it again.

I know that you will be glad to hear that Dr. Frost
is getting on splendidly with the final editing of Father's
MS at the Hopkins School of Hygiene and that Miss Brown, my
associate, and myself are doing well with the remaining un-
verified references, although we have reached the place where
“the law of diminishing returns” is decidedly in evidence--i. e.
we must search further and work longer for every reference we
verify.

It was a great pleasure and privelege to see you again,
and please tell your daughter how glad I am that she has still
the great good fortune of having with her such a Father! I'm
able to appreciate how she feels about it!

Once more, with heartfelt appreciation of all your
kindness, I remain
div1.closer:
Most truly yours, Laura Armistead Carter Dr. L. O. Howard,
Principal Entomologist,
United States Department of Agriculture,
Bureau of Entomology,
Washington, D. C.
